text.0: the singers welcome with their hymns and praises the goddess dawn who bringeth in the sunlight.
text.1: sublime by law true to eternal order bright on her path redtinted farrefulgent.
text.2: she comes in front fair rousing up the people making the pathways easy to be travelled.
text.3: high on her lofty chariot allimpelling dawn gives her splendour at the days beginning.
text.4: she harnessing her car with purple oxen injuring none hath brought perpetual riches.
text.5: opening paths to happiness the goddess shines praised by all giver of every blessing.
text.6: with changing tints she gleams in double splendour while from the eastward she displays her body.
text.7: she travels perfectly the path of order nor fails to reach as one who knows the quarters.
text.8: as conscious that her limbs are bright with bathing she stands as twere erect that we may see her.
text.9: driving away malignity and darkness dawn child of heaven hath come to us with lustre.
text.10: the daughter of the sky like some chaste woman bends opposite to men her forehead downward.
text.11: the maid disclosing boons to him who worships hath brought again the daylight as aforetime.
